page.title: 04Unemployment in Glastonbury
page.content: In the past few months there has been increasing outbreaks of{vandalism}in Glastonbury. Although these have by no means reached serious proportions, the incidents worry the townspeople. Situated as it is in the centre of rural farmland Glastonbury seems an unlikely place to find the hooliganism which is affecting other more urban areas of English society. The blame appears to lie with{boredom and {unemployment. }Two major local industries have closed down recently. {Morlands,a sheepskin factory specialising in the production of quality leather goods was forced out of production. {Snows, a local fuel and{timber merchant,}has also just closed. The firm's bankruptcy has thrown on to the open market many young people who will find it difficult to find new employment.
